conclusion: Determine the maximum horizontal force F that can be applied to block B without causing block A to slide relative to block B.
Block A is on top of block B, and a force F is applied horizontally to block B.
Weight of block A is 10 N.
Normal force from block B on block A is 10 N.
Maximum static friction force between A and B is 1 N.
Weight of block B is 20 N.
Normal force from the ground on block B is 30 N.
Kinetic friction force between B and the ground is 3 N.
F must not exceed the force required to overcome static friction between A and B.
Maximum force F that can be applied to block B is 4 N.
Final answer: Maximum horizontal force F is 4 N.
